comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_N._Funston Frederick N. Funston (September 11, 1865 – February 19, 1917) also known as Fred Funston, was a General in the United States Army, best known for his role in the Spanish-American War and the Philippine-American War. He received the Medal of Honor for his actions during the Philippine-American War.

comment.author: 7674191@N03
comment._content:
General Funston brought order to San Francisco, and literaly saved San Francisco from city wide fire after the 1906 earthquake.  Something that the corrupt leaders of the city were incapable of doing. 
Fort Funston in San Francisco was named after him.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: thank you Richard Arthur Norton and 5150PLB for providing more information about General Funston. There are more images of him in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog including this one: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2005690058/

comment.author: 74631517@N05
comment._content: Born in Iola, Kansas, where they have preserved his home as a museum.
